aboutme: After several internships in microbiology at Institut Pasteur (Patrick Grimont, Philippe Glaser, Sylvain Brisse), I went to Joel Doré's Lab to do a PhD headed by Marion Leclerc. My main project was to study dietary fiber effects on human gut microbiota using notably metagenomic and metatranscriptomic approach. Since my PhD, my research interest focused on interactions between nutrition, gut microbiota and human health. As post-doc successively done at EMBL in Peer Bork’s group and at INRA Metagenopolis unit (Joel Doré, Dusko Ehrlich), I used several approaches like numerical ecology and machine learning technics to untangle big omics data with clinical and dietary data. This allowed me to work with different AP-HP and DKFZ clinicians. I am currently microbiome scientist at Danone Nutricia Research center settled in Paris-Saclay campus where I am working on microbiome scientist linked with nutrition and digestive health.

## Resaerch Article

```{r publications2}

articles_to_remove = c("bioRxiv","MICROBIAL ECOLOGY","Université Pierre et Marie Curie",
                      "Microbial Ecology","Obesity Reviews", "Diabetes & Metabolism",
                      "EP Patent EP", "Arthritis & Rheumatology", "Current Opinion in Food Science",
                      "médecine/sciences", "The Second International Conference on Holobionts",
                      "Reference Module in Food Science", "Current Developments in Nutrition")

conference_preceding = c("MICROBIAL ECOLOGY","Microbial Ecology","Obesity Reviews", "Diabetes & Metabolism",
                         "Arthritis & Rheumatology", "The Second International Conference on Holobionts",
                         "Current Developments in Nutrition")

reviews_book = c("Current Opinion in Food Science","médecine/sciences","Reference Module in Food Science")

patent_id = "EP Patent EP"



scholar_id <- "aYTQ-WkAAAAJ"
library(dplyr)
library(stringr)
library(scholar)
pubs <- scholar::get_publications(id = scholar_id) %>% mutate(author = as.character(author))
pubs %>% 
      rowwise() %>% 
      mutate(
        author = case_when(
          str_ends(as.character(author), "\\.\\.\\.") ~ get_complete_authors(id = scholar_id, pubid = pubid),
          TRUE ~ as.character(author)
      )
      ) -> pubs

pubs %>%
   ungroup() %>%
distinct(title, .keep_all = TRUE) %>%
  transmute(bibtype = "Article", author = as.character(author),
            title = as.character(title),
            journaltitle = as.character(journal), year, key = row_number()) %>%
  arrange(desc(year)) %>%
  filter(year > 2008) %>%
  filter(!(journaltitle %in% articles_to_remove)) %>%
  
  mutate(key = row_number()) %>%
  detailed_entries(what = author,when = year, where = journaltitle, with = paste0(key,". ", title)  )
  #brief_entries(what = paste0(author,". ",title), when = year, with= journaltitle)
```
